Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Paragraph 37(1)(b) of the IRPA, Section 117 of the IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Application of wilful blindness and interpretation of statutory provisions
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant deemed inadmissible for people smuggling
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review of Immigration Division decision
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Role as crew on MV Sun Sea, knowledge imputed via wilful blindness
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Inference of knowledge through wilful blindness
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Admissibility hearing before ID, followed by judicial review
Crimes.Country_of_Origin: Sri Lanka (implied by applicant being Tamil refugee)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to ID's interpretation
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Record of proceedings before ID, applicant’s role and conditions
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration Division, Federal Court on review
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Engagement in people smuggling under s. 117 and para 37(1)(b)
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence regarding crew role and intent
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly mentioned; findings based on objective conduct
Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Aiding illegal entry into Canada without required documents
Crimes.Risk_Assessment_Factors: Participation in organized migrant transport operation
Crimes.Accusation: Aiding in the smuggling of persons via MV Sun Sea
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Interpretation of 'people smuggling' and application of wilful blindness
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: Not central; reliance on conduct and imputed knowledge
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Not applicable — claimant status not granted due to inadmissibility
Crimes.Mode_of_Entry: By boat (MV Sun Sea), irregular entry
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation of 'people smuggling' under IRPA and application of wilful blindness
Crimes.Decision_Level: Federal Court (judicial review of Immigration Division)

Crimes.Crime_Name: Organized Criminality under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Paragraph 37(1)(b) of the IRPA, Section 117 of the IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant found inadmissible due to involvement in people smuggling
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Conduct as crew member facilitating undocumented entry
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Use of circumstantial evidence and inference of intent
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Admissibility hearing, right to appeal or review
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Operational details of MV Sun Sea voyage, applicant’s role
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration Division, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Participation in organized entry without documentation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Engagement in people smuggling under para 37(1)(b)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not emphasized; focus on objective elements of conduct
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Challenge to legal interpretation by ID
Crimes.Accusation: Involvement in organized people smuggling operation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Correctness of ID’s interpretation of 'people smuggling'
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Not considered due to inadmissibility bar
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether 'people smuggling' requires material benefit or clandestine intent
Crimes.Decision_Level: Federal Court reviewing Immigration Division decision
